DataElement.preferredName: Eligibility Criteria CLIA Laboratory Documented BRAF V600 Mutation Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator for whether or not patient has documented BRAF-V600 mutation by CLIA approved laboratory.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Clinical Laboratory Improvement Act Laboratory Documented BRAF V600 Mutation
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria._A Federal law establishing quality standards for all laboratory testing to ensure the accuracy, reliability and timeliness of patient test results regardless of where the test was performed and also to determine if laboratories are achieving those standards._A facility equipped and competent to conduct scientific experiments, observations, tests, investigations, and/or to manufacture chemicals or medical products._Furnished with or supported by documents and documentation._An activated mutation in the BRAF gene involving an amino acid change at position 600.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Property.preferredName: Clinical Laboratory Improvement Act Laboratory Documented BRAF V600 Mutation
Property.preferredDefinition: A Federal law establishing quality standards for all laboratory testing to ensure the accuracy, reliability and timeliness of patient test results regardless of where the test was performed and also to determine if laboratories are achieving those standards.:A facility equipped and competent to conduct scientific experiments, observations, tests, investigations, and/or to manufacture chemicals or medical products.:Furnished with or supported by documents and documentation.:An activated mutation in the BRAF gene involving an amino acid change at position 600.

Concepts.definition: A Federal law establishing quality standards for all laboratory testing to ensure the accuracy, reliability and timeliness of patient test results regardless of where the test was performed and also to determine if laboratories are achieving those standards.
A facility equipped and competent to conduct scientific experiments, observations, tests, investigations, and/or to manufacture chemicals or medical products.
Furnished with or supported by documents and documentation.
An activated mutation in the BRAF gene involving an amino acid change at position 600.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does the patient have previou
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have previously documented BRAF-V600 E or K mutation as performed by PCR or next generation sequencing in a CLIA-approved laboratory?
